summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Parker, submitting an application for warrants for cellphone location information related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The email references an indictment to be presented to a grand jury and an arrest warrant, indicating imminent legal action against Maxwell.

persons.name: Parker
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Parker for review of an application for warrants for cellphone location information related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of Indictment and Arrest Warrant
persons.context: The application is for cellphone location information related to Maxwell, and references an indictment and arrest warrant against her.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is submitting the warrant application and coordinating the indictment presentation.

connections.description: The AUSA is submitting legal documents (warrant application, indictment, arrest warrant) targeting Maxwell.
Judge Parker is being asked to review and authorize warrants related to the investigation and prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The government intends to present an indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to a grand jury in White Plains, with an anticipated return around 11:30am.

events.title: Anticipated Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell is referenced, to be executed following the grand jury indictment.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On June 29, 2020, federal prosecutors applied for warrants to obtain Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone location information.
The government planned to present an indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to a grand jury in White Plains on June 30, 2020.
An arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell was prepared, with execution anticipated around 11:30am on June 30, 2020, following the grand jury's return of the indictment.
The correspondence indicates coordinated, imminent legal action by the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell.
